answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample of cost of living adjustments in recent budgets. You may want to contact each area individually for more information on their system.
This is the 2011 budget from Somerset County, NJ; Sheet 3a-2 discusses the Cost of Living Index Rate.
http://www.co.somerset.nj.us/pdf/2011budgetadopted.pdf
You can also view the full NJ state policy here.
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=2&ved=0CC0QFjAB&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nj.gov%2Fdca%2Flgs%2Flfns%2F11lfns%2F2011-23.doc&ei=Fr0dT6uUCI2DsgLBjq3jCw&usg=AFQjCNHrRFsYFBQWC7lLUJ0VLSftWq2diA&sig2=Vv7PW6i9WtVtHIkfW7iGNw
Loudon County, VA also implemented a Cost of Living adjustment in their 2012 budget.
http://www.loudoun.gov/Default.aspx?tabid=3705
The El Paso, TX 2011 budget deals with cost of living in their Compensation and Public Safety sections of their budget on pages 8 and 9.
http://www.elpasotexas.gov/omb/_documents/2011_Budget_Detail%20-%2001%20Budget%20Summary.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Michelle Flaherty
text: What are the most widely used/accepted methods for adjusting your budget for cost of living changes?  Do you use CPI alone, or combine it with another measure?  How often do you adjust:  yearly or every 2 years or does it depend on how much change has occurred?
title: Keeping up with inflation, etc.
